body: Added installcheck to cover "money" data type (both to good, serial and parallel checks)

I think it would be good to add the two cases that failed to installcheck-good. I checked, and there is already a temp test suite (src/test/regress/expected/temp.out, src/test/regress/sql/temp.sql) that can be a good place for them.
Thanks all for reviewing. Changes has been pushed - commit id - e424ad49e3a3ad9264cdca2f257ec6b432f806b0
LGTM. Unless somebody complains I'll be merging this today.
@ictmalili Would you please review this PR. Thanks
+1 , the code looks good to me..

Cool! 

BTW, There are 2 points here:
(1) It seems we need to add meta info for functions you added(e.g. int8_mul_cash() ) into below files:
apache-hawq/src/backend/utils/fmgrtab.c
apache-hawq/src/include/catalog/pg_operator.h
apache-hawq/src/include/catalog/pg_proc.h 

(2) I saw you changed argument type to int64 for function cash_div_int4(), but didn't change for fucntion 
cash_div_int2(). I guess you may want to fix the problem caused by (1) point above. So please revert this change. It may cause the result precision problem.
+1 if memory context issue is fixed.

This PR has now been open for over 30 days.  

I see that HAWQ-316 has been marked resolved, did you simply forget to close the PR?

This PR has now been open for over 30 days.  

I see that HAWQ-274 was marked as resolved, did you simply forget to close the PR?
This PR has been open for 29 days, and has enough +1 votes to move forward.  Anything blocking it from being resolved?
Open for 29 days, +2 on votes, can we get this merged?
What is the current status on this PR?  Are there still outstanding issues to resolve, or is it ready for merge?

it's pretty much ready - Christian still needs to run automation test (this is still proprietary as we haven't open sourced automation yet), he's on business trip this week and will pick it up after he returns next week.
There are also a few minor fixes to be merged: https://github.com/tzolov/incubator-hawq/pull/1
As Noa said we are waiting on Jemish's certification of this patch against a secure Isilon cluster.

Not yet, I haven't gotten approval to merge it.
I will merge it ASAP when getting approval. Thanks.

Good idea. For a quick fix, we can use CacheMemoryContext which is 8M at maximum.

We are investigating on plan context for different queries including:
1) SPI query
2) Named prepared statement
3) Unnamed prepared statement
After that, we can use more appropriate memory context for prepared plan accordingly. This will be a separate improvement.
+1 and it's better to reuse dispatcherAYT, because executormgr_validate_conn  and dispatcherAYT have a lot of repeated codes.
One more thing, is there a need to consider errno == EWOULDBLOCK in your executormgr_validate_conn()  if connection is nonblocking

Yes, function executormgr_validate_conn and dispatcherAYT have repeated code, but I'm not sure whether we can merge the two functions into one since dispatcherAYT is in ic_udp.c and interconnect seems an independent part. Shall we merge that? @changleicn
Yes, I'll add that errno check errno == EWOULDBLOCK in the code. And seems that EAGAIN and EWOULDBLOCK often return same values.

Reproduce steps:

```
create table sale
(
cn int not null,
vn int not null,
pn int not null,
dt date not null,
qty int not null,
prc float not null

) WITH (appendonly=true, orientation = parquet) distributed randomly;

insert into sale values ( 4, 40, 800, '1401-6-1', 1, 1);

select MAX(DISTINCT sale.vn),MAX(DISTINCT sale.prc) FROM sale GROUP BY (sale.prc),ROLLUP(sale.prc);
```

No results is returned.
I have fixed the issue I pointed out above, and merged this change into master branch. Please close this pull request. Thanks.
Can you post the link to the updated coverity build to verify if there are no more leaks
@shivzone I did run coverity build on local branch, not sure if this link is accessible outside.
Sorry, I was in a trip so didn't have time to work on this. Thank you for fixing it
Is it possible to have an ICG test for this fix?
Not sure how to add ICG with simex on. If there is any suggestion please let us know.
@foyzur Please take a look when you have time.
+1 The code change is ok to me.
Jemish is on paternity leave until Mar 1st. He will pick up the verification and update us.
It definitely LGTM as we worked together on this one :-p So, I guess you need two more LGTM from other people.
